scenario:
The stock market softened at the end of 2024 due to a more cautious Federal Reserve and lingering inflation concerns. However, this dip has led to price target boosts for several strong tech stocks, including Meta Platforms, Amazon, and Alphabet. 

Meta Platforms saw a 70% gain in 2024, with shares reaching all-time highs in mid-December. Analysts, including JPMorgan Chase, have raised their price targets, with JPMorgan Chase boosting its target to $725, indicating a potential 25% upside. 

Amazon also had a strong 2024, with shares logging more than 180% gains before softening at the end of the year. Analysts, including UBS Group, JMP Securities, and Tigress Financial, have reiterating their Buy ratings, with Tigress Financial setting a $290 price target, indicating a potential 30% upside. 

Alphabet, the parent company of Google, also had a strong 2024, with shares reaching an all-time high in December. Analysts, including Bank of America and JPMorgan Chase, have reiterating their Buy ratings, with JPMorgan Chase boosting its price target to $232, indicating a potential 20% upside.
